name: Guatemala
description: Guatemala, a land of vibrant culture, stunning landscapes, and ancient history, is nestled in the heart of Central America.  It’s a country defined by its dramatic volcanic peaks, lush rainforests, and the mighty Mayan civilization.  From the bustling markets of Antigua to the serene beauty of Lake Atitlán, Guatemala offers a diverse and unforgettable travel experience.  The country’s economy is largely based on agriculture, particularly coffee production, and tourism.

quickFacts.label: Population
quickFacts.description: Guatemala boasts a diverse population, primarily of Mayan descent, alongside Spanish and other ethnic groups.
quickFacts.detail: The majority of the population lives in rural areas, relying on agriculture for their livelihoods.

quickFacts.label: Capital
quickFacts.description: Guatemala City is the political, economic, and cultural center of the country.
quickFacts.detail: It's a sprawling metropolis with a rich history and a vibrant urban life.

quickFacts.label: Official Language
quickFacts.description: Spanish is the official language, but Mayan languages are widely spoken throughout the country.
quickFacts.detail: Approximately 22 Mayan languages are still actively spoken.

quickFacts.label: Currency
quickFacts.description: The currency of Guatemala is the Quetzal, named after the national bird.
quickFacts.detail: One US dollar is approximately 8.3 Quetzales.

quickFacts.label: Area
quickFacts.description: Guatemala is a relatively small country with a diverse geography.
quickFacts.detail: It borders Mexico to the north, Belize to the west, Honduras to the east, and El Salvador to the south.

climateData.title: Climate Overview
climateData.description: Guatemala experiences a tropical climate with variations depending on altitude and region. The lowlands are hot and humid year-round, while the highlands are cooler and drier.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Dry Season
seasonalCharacteristics.description: The dry season is generally sunny and pleasant, making it ideal for travel. However, it can also be quite hot, especially in the lowlands.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Wet Season
seasonalCharacteristics.description: The wet season brings frequent rainfall, particularly in the afternoons.  It’s a lush and vibrant time of year, but can make some activities challenging.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Hurricane Season
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Guatemala is susceptible to hurricanes and tropical storms during this period. Travelers should monitor weather forecasts and be prepared for potential disruptions.

naturalWonders.name: Lake Atitlán
naturalWonders.description: Lake Atitlán is a stunning volcanic crater lake surrounded by towering volcanoes and traditional Mayan villages. It’s considered one of the most beautiful lakes in the world.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: Formed by a volcanic eruption, the lake’s deep blue waters reflect the surrounding mountains, creating a breathtaking panorama.  Each of the villages surrounding the lake has a unique culture and traditions.
viewingTips: Take a boat trip to explore the different villages
Enjoy the sunset over the lake

naturalWonders.name: Tacaná Volcano
naturalWonders.description: Tacaná Volcano is the highest point in Guatemala, offering spectacular views and a challenging hike.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: This active volcano is part of the Trans-Mexican Volcanic Belt. The summit offers panoramic views of the surrounding highlands and the border with Mexico.  The crater lake is a unique feature.
viewingTips: Check weather conditions before heading out

ecosystemData.title: Guatemala's Ecosystems
ecosystemData.overview: Guatemala boasts a remarkable diversity of ecosystems, ranging from tropical rainforests to cloud forests and volcanic highlands. These ecosystems support a rich array of plant and animal life.

biodiversityCategories.name: Tropical Rainforest
biodiversityCategories.description: Guatemala’s rainforests are home to an incredible variety of plant and animal species, including jaguars, monkeys, toucans, and countless insects.

statistics.details: Guatemala is one of the most biodiverse countries in the Americas.

notableSpecies.name: Quetzal
notableSpecies.significance: Symbol of Guatemala and a beautiful bird.

biodiversityCategories.name: Cloud Forest
biodiversityCategories.description: Cloud forests are found in the higher elevations of the Guatemalan highlands, characterized by persistent cloud cover and abundant rainfall.

statistics.details: High altitude creates a unique microclimate.

notableSpecies.name: Resplendent Quetzal
notableSpecies.significance: Iconic bird of the cloud forest.

notableSpecies.name: Howler Monkeys
notableSpecies.significance: Dominant primate in the cloud forest.

activities.title: Outdoor Activities in Guatemala
activities.description: Guatemala offers a wide range of outdoor activities for all levels of experience, from hiking and birdwatching to rafting and exploring ancient ruins.

activityCategories.name: Hiking
activityCategories.description: Explore Guatemala’s stunning landscapes on foot.

activities.name: Pacaya Volcano Hike
activities.description: Hike to the crater of Pacaya Volcano and witness its active lava flows.

activities.name: Semuc Champey Trek
activities.description: Trek through the jungle to reach the stunning turquoise pools of Semuc Champey.

activityCategories.name: Water Sports
activityCategories.description: Enjoy the country’s many rivers, lakes, and waterfalls.

activities.name: Rafting on the Cahabón River
activities.description: Raft down the scenic Cahabón River, surrounded by lush rainforest.

activities.name: Canyoning at El Salto del Bruja
activities.description: Descend waterfalls and rappel through canyons in this thrilling adventure.

clothing.winter: Warm layers, waterproof jacket, hat, gloves

equipment.hiking: Hiking boots, trekking poles, first-aid kit
